content: I was mentioning @simulacrum on a different stream that I was using https://calendar.google.com/calendar/embed?src=mozilla.com_ts4qudb88i0tbjef8rche4a6v4%40group.calendar.google.com&ctz=America%2FMontevideo to follow Rust releases, which I have no idea from where I got it :)
it seem that I'm following that since ages and I thought it was an official source of Rust release dates

it would be great for @WG-prioritization efforts to know when releases happen, in particular to make announcements in the compiler meetings about it and also to know better when we should push harder for backports
unsure if it's possible to build a calendar like that or which could be a good official source to keep track of when releases happen
At least for regular .0 releases, they have always been exactly 6 weeks apart, and the next few are listed on the front page of the forge
stable point release are more ad-hoc
for issues we also track them via milestones: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/milestones

cuviper said:

At least for regular .0 releases, they have always been exactly 6 weeks apart, and the next few are listed on the front page of the forge

yeah I think the linked calendar follow those but I'm more interested in knowing a bit beforehand about the other ones if possible
we don't have a fixed date for point releases, we generally pick a date where it is comfortable for us to get the changes in
hey t-release is there something you can do so the rest and in particular @WG-prioritization can be aware of releases dates a bit beforehand?
I guess if you were having a calendar it would be nice because also Rust users can follow it and be aware of releases

as I've said above, I used to follow and still do follow https://calendar.google.com/calendar/embed?src=mozilla.com_ts4qudb88i0tbjef8rche4a6v4%40group.calendar.google.com&ctz=America%2FMontevideo but @simulacrum told me that the thing is dated and not official
I mean, it's pretty hard - it is not uncommon for us to turn around a release in less than a week
Certainly I can ping prioritization wg in a topic here when we schedule it

I'm willing to help maintain a calendar. I've wanted to have more rust org calendars in general. We don't really have a place for that right now, but I can maintain a unofficial one in the meantime that should hopefully catch patch releases. Does that work for you @Santiago Pastorino?
@XAMPPRocky definitely :heart:
whatever you do is fine for me, if you just want to ping us when you schedule that's also enough

XAMPPRocky said:

I'm willing to help maintain a calendar. I've wanted to have more rust org calendars in general. We don't really have a place for that right now, but I can maintain a unofficial one in the meantime that should hopefully catch patch releases. Does that work for you Santiago Pastorino?

but also, agree with this, having a release calendar is good because also users can be prepared and also schedule their systems upgrades too
I don't disagree -- it's just that I don't know how useful it is to see additions within 2-3 days of the release occurring
we're also not shipping a webserver or anything that I'm super worried about getting people notified urgently
Well I think that's why a calendar would be preferred, because it's not a notification, it's just an event.
I don't think anyone is asking for urgency, it seems more like a nice to have.
@Santiago Pastorino https://calendar.google.com/calendar?cid=bDFiMWdrcXZmYmd1bmpzMThuZW1xNGM1ODBAZ3JvdXAuY2FsZW5kYXIuZ29vZ2xlLmNvbQ
since i'm a common factor in both teams, if you need any clarifications on releases, you can ping me :smile:

XAMPPRocky said:

Santiago Pastorino https://calendar.google.com/calendar?cid=bDFiMWdrcXZmYmd1bmpzMThuZW1xNGM1ODBAZ3JvdXAuY2FsZW5kYXIuZ29vZ2xlLmNvbQ

great, thanks, this is more than enough
@XAMPPRocky have you created events already? or is it empty?
I'm seeing that the old release calendar was created by Aaron Turon
and they've added every 6 weeks a recurring release event
@Santiago Pastorino It should have events. I see events. on the 27th and 3rd of august.

XAMPPRocky said:

Santiago Pastorino It should have events. I see events. on the 27th and 3rd of august.

I don't see anything
/me hates Google calendar
I’ll try and fix that today, don’t know why that’s the case.
@Santiago Pastorino Do you see a release on the 27th now?
@XAMPPRocky now yes
Okay, I had to explicitly make the event public to work for some reason.
